text:
*edit:* it should have been `{% unless lang.glossary %}` :man-facepalming::skin-tone-2:
FYI, the DM gives an import cycle detected warning in the following scenario when it theoretically shouldn’t.
The file `glossary.html` is to be imported in multiple files. The `glossary.html` file has this at top: `{% set glossary = true %}`.
Here is what I am using to import it into multiple files:
```{% unless glossary %}{% import 'path/to/glossary.html' as lang %}{% endunless %} {# warning #}```
However, the DM does not throw the warning when I take out `as lang`
```{% unless glossary %}{% import 'path/to/glossary.html' %}{% endunless %} {# no warning #}```
In that case, would it now need to be `unless lang.glossary`?
shiznit <@U26B530N6>! You are awesome… and I have dain-bramage.
lol this kind of stuff trips me up daily
